Description: Rim and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery eye-cup; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; reserved edge of tondo preserved with one black line and trace of more black; top of rim glazed; exterior: narrow band below rim; below, black-figure decoration consisting of part of eye (with added white and iris made up of a circle and three bands, the middle band in added red), eyebrow and part of nose; vines around handle zone; below, two pairs of narrow black bands and band of alternating black and outline rays.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The sherd belongs to the same vase as two other joining sherds designated as Oxford AN1896-1908-G.1053 and AN1896-1908-G.1053(2) for clarity. This sherd comes from the reverse of AN1896-1908-G.1053, which it joins beside the handle.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0603) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
